Classes#

class model_atm.Model(nx=0, ny=0, nval=0)[source]#

Class containing the models of a simulation

Parameters:

  • tau (numpy.array) – Array with the log tau

  • T (numpy.ndarray) – Temperature in K

  • Pe (numpy.ndarray) – Electron Pressure in dyn/cm\(^2\)

  • vmicro (numpy.ndarray) – Microturbulence Velocity in cm/s

  • B (numpy.ndarray) – Magnetic Field Strength in G

  • vlos (numpy.ndarray) – Line-of-Sight Velocity in km/s

  • gamma (numpy.ndarray) – Inclination in deg

  • phi (numpy.ndarray) – Azimuth in deg

  • z (numpy.ndarray) – z in km

  • Pg (numpy.ndarray) – Gas pressure in dyn/cm\(^2\)

  • rho (numpy.ndarray) – Density in g/cm\(^3\)

  • vmacro (numpy.array) – Macroturbulence Velocity in km/s

  • fill (numpy.array) – Filling factor

  • stray_light (numpy.array) – Stray Light Factor in Percent

  • nx (int) – Dimension in x

  • ny (int) – Dimension in y

  • nval (int) – Dimension along log_tau

Return type:

None

Methods

correct_phi()

SIR can give you any value for the azimuth, e.g. -250 deg, and therefore, to compute the standard deviation those values should be corrected so that I have values from 0 to 360 degrees.

cut_to_map(Map)

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

get_attribute(string)

Returns a specific physical parameter.

interp(new_tau)

Interpolate the model to a new log tau scale.

read(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a binary model file.

read_mod(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a model file from SIR and assigns the value to the class.

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)

Reads all the errors from the inversion

set_dim(nx, ny, nval)

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

set_limit(lim)

Cuts the arrays to a specific log tau value (should only be used for plotting).

write(fname[, fmt_type])

Write data into a binary fortran file

write_model(filename, x, y)

Write a model with the given data in a specific format.
correct_phi()[source]#

SIR can give you any value for the azimuth, e.g. -250 deg, and therefore, to compute the standard deviation those values should be corrected so that I have values from 0 to 360 degrees.

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None

cut_to_map(Map)[source]#

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

Parameters:

Map (list) – List with the ranges in pixel in x and y direction

Return type:

None

get_attribute(string)[source]#

Returns a specific physical parameter. This can be used if ones only wants a specific parameter depending on a string/input.

Parameters:

string (str) – Determines which physical parameter is returned Options are: tau, T, Pe, vmicro, B, vlos, gamma, phi, z, Pg, rho, nx, ny, npar, fill

Returns:

out – The wished physical parameter

Return type:

float

interp(new_tau)[source]#

Interpolate the model to a new log tau scale.

Parameters:

new_tau (numpy array) – New log tau scale

Return type:

None

read(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#

Reads a binary model file.

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – Filename

  • fmt_type (type, optional) – Type used to laod data. Default: np.float64

Return type:

None

read_mod(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#

Reads a model file from SIR and assigns the value to the class. This class will then create the class with nx = ny = 1.

Parameters:

fname (str) – Name of the .mod file

Return type:

None

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)[source]#

Reads all the errors from the inversion

Parameters:

  • task (dict) – Dictionary with all the task folders, x and y positions

  • filename (str) – Filename of the file in each task folder

  • path (str) – Path where all the files are

  • nx (int) – how many results are read in x

  • ny (int) – how many results are read in y

Return type:

None

set_dim(nx, ny, nval)[source]#

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

Parameters:

  • nx (int) – Number of Models in x

  • ny (int) – Number of Models in y

  • nval (int) – Number of values per physical parameter

Return type:

None

set_limit(lim)[source]#

Cuts the arrays to a specific log tau value (should only be used for plotting).

Parameters:

lim (int) – log tau value to which the values are cut

Return type:

None

write(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#

Write data into a binary fortran file

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – File name

  • fmt_type (type) – type which is used to save it => numpy.float64 used

Return type:

None

write_model(filename, x, y)[source]#

Write a model with the given data in a specific format.

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – Name of the saved file

  • x (int) – Integer determining which model

  • y (int) – Integer determining which model

Return type:

None

class profile_stk.Profile(nx=None, ny=None, nw=0)[source]#

Class containing the models of a simulation

Parameters:

  • wave (nump.array) – Wavelength

  • indx (numpy array) – Index or line numbers in mode ‘MC’

  • stki (mxn numpy.array) – Stokes Parameter I

  • stkq (mxn numpy.array) – Stokes Parameter Q

  • stku (mxn numpy.array) – Stokes Parameter U

  • stkv (mxn numpy.array) – Stokes Parameter V

  • nx (int) – Dimension in x

  • ny (int) – Dimension in y

  • ns (int) – Number of Stokes Parameter

  • nw (int) – Dimension in wavelength

  • load (bool) – Data was loaded

  • data_cut (bool) – Data was cut to the inversion range

Methods

cut_to_map(Map)

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

cut_to_wave(range_wave)

Cut the data to the range in wavelengths

read(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a binary profile file

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)

Reads all the errors from the inversion

read_results_MC(path, tasks, filename)

Reads all the profiles for the simulation where indx is the line number

set_dim(nx, ny, nw)

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

veil_correction(nu[, Ic])

Correct the spectrum for the spectral veil by simly inverting the convoluted equation.

write(fname[, fmt_type])

Write data into a binary fortran file

write_profile(filename, x, y, Grid)

Writes data to profiles as described in the config file Note to call cut_to_wave, otherwise it writes the wrong profiles!

write_profile_mc(filename, x)

Writes data to SIR profiles as described in the config file

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

Parameters:

Map (list) – List with the ranges in pixel in x and y direction

cut_to_wave(range_wave)[source]#

Cut the data to the range in wavelengths

Parameters:

range_wave (multidimensional list) – List with the ranges from the config file

read(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float32'>)[source]#

Reads a binary profile file

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – Name of the binary file

  • fmt_type (type, optional) – Type of the binary file. Default: np.float32

Return type:

None

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)[source]#

Reads all the errors from the inversion

Parameters:

  • task (dict) – Dictionary with all the task folders, x and y positions

  • filename (str) – Filename of the file in each task folder

  • path (str) – Path where all the files are

  • nx (int) – how many results are read in x

  • ny (int) – how many results are read in y

Return type:

None

read_results_MC(path, tasks, filename)[source]#

Reads all the profiles for the simulation where indx is the line number

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Config information

  • tasks (dict) – Dictionary with the folder names

  • Type (string, optional) – Indicating if synthesis or inversion. Default: ‘syn’

Return type:

None

set_dim(nx, ny, nw)[source]#

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

Parameters:

  • nx (int) – Number of Models in x

  • ny (int) – Number of Models in y

  • nw (int) – Number of wavelength points

Return type:

None

veil_correction(nu, Ic=1.0)[source]#

Correct the spectrum for the spectral veil by simly inverting the convoluted equation.

Parameters:

  • nu (float) – Optimized fraction of spectral veil

  • Ic (float, optional) – Continuum intensity of the FTS. Default is “1.0”.

Return type:

None

write(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float32'>)[source]#

Write data into a binary fortran file

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – File name

  • fmt_type (type, optional) – type which is used to save it => numpy.float32 used. Default: np.float32

Return type:

None

write_profile(filename, x, y, Grid)[source]#

Writes data to profiles as described in the config file Note to call cut_to_wave, otherwise it writes the wrong profiles!

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – String containing the output path of the profile

  • x (int) – Position in x

  • y (int) – Position in y

  • Grid (str) – Grid file

Return type:

None

write_profile_mc(filename, x)[source]#

Writes data to SIR profiles as described in the config file

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – String containing the output path of the profile

  • x (int) – Position in x

  • y (int) – Position in y

  • Grid (str) – Grid file

Return type:

None
